name: owangutang
text: Inspired by true events?

name: eviltkat
text: My theory is he flushed his underpants.  Any other theories?

name: geysershitdick
text: have you ever seen a dude's stew

name: deancain29
text: wonderful

name: woodenteeth
text: "things ain't never the same once you seen a dude's stew"... man, the number of times this line has jammed it's way to my consciousness when I've gone to some low bathroom at 3am and been Confronted.

name: pitseleh
text: I'm shocked this isn't rated higher. This is CLASSIC!

name: rowboat
text: It is a CLASSIC, but it's also a RERUN! It got a five the first time. That's all it gets from me.

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by implode, riotdejaneiro, Semiquaver, atticusonline, the_dingle, aHatOfPig)

name: foea
text: yes, yes, we all know you're a prick.

name: i_love_kate
text: Uh, I do the same thing. I've never understood the use of admittedly classic strips to assuage the audience in place of a new one. I'd much prefer no update at all, so yes, I rate them 1.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
i refuse to rate them...
i think. hang on.
yep. no rating.

name: ricnine
text: Every time I read this strip, I sing that part aloud.

name: bovine
text: yeah. i like to pick up my guitar and strum a chord for it.

name: saddestking
text:
a big, surfy chord and you play it right after the words and not a moment before

Where~is~Ray~ *BWAOOOOOWWWWWWwwWWwwWWW!*

name: sp1derbaby
text:
Would you know my pants
If I lost them in heaven?

name: trollcollins
text:
Achewood has the best textual representations of sing-songy voice.

"[sing]Where is Ray?[/sing]"

"Guess who just got [sing]yelled at?[/sing]"

We all know how it is meant to sound. It is a triumph within the comic medium.

name: cinderfella
text: I like to imagine that the two sung lines are different songs and that in panel 4 he is singing 'In heaven, everything is fine' from Eraserhead. It fills me with sunny dismay.

name: songbirdspectre
text: You my most disgusting friend you know that. 5.

name: kelissamunz
text: Somehow I always imagine Ray singing "Where is Ray" to the tune of "Bird of Pray" by The Doors.

name: canusdivinus
text: I use reruns to give the extra I wish I coulda given the first time around. This strip should have ranked about 7 or so on a 5-point scale, so 5 for the first part and the extra 2 here.

name: nighend
text: I saw the rating for this one and I was going to write something about "what the hell is wrong with you people" but then I noticed the title.

name: dejavroom
text:
"where's your underpants?"
"in heaven..."

name: bambule
text: In Heaven ... everything is fine.
